title: Analist politic la televiziunea de stat a Rusiei: ”Aș bombarda România, nu Polonia. Știți de ce? Pentru că au devenit prea aroganți”
cleaned_sentences: Political analyst on Russia's state television: "I would bomb Romania, not Poland.
Because they have become too arrogant" Russian political analyst Dmitri Evstafiev suggested in a program on Russia 1 state television, that Moscow should bomb Romania.

Professor at the Moscow School of Economics, Evstafiev was invited by Vladimir Soloviov, considered to be a Kremlin's gorges, in a show in which the moderator and guests frequently launch threats to Ukraine, but also to its allies, including Romania or the Western European States.

But I would not bomb Poland now.
I have not yet negotiated with them," said Evstafiev, according to a fragment of debate, posted on X, the former Twitter.
They became too arrogant," the political schedule continued.
"The Romanians obviously started to behave arrogant.
I would put the Romanians in their place.
I would carefully hit some Romanian military bases through which the military aid, ammunition and all the others are sent (to Ukraine, n.r.
